title: Translating into Korean?
content:
I’m working on a custom publication for a client who eventually wants it to be translated from English into Korean. I know you can copy Korean text out of Word and import it into InDesign, but it’s not working on my Mac. Do I need a special typeface?

 [‹ experience with Baskerville Book?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906210404/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44878 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need a condensed serif for a nameplate ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906210404/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44879 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Pfunk

comments.content:
I do this all the time and it works.Apple and Adobe both provide Asian fonts, so there should be enough to choose from. They are listed at the bottom of the font menu, past the English fonts. Look for Apple Gothic or Adobe Myungio.

David
